main event: On 23 February 1955 in Wilton, Connecticut, a civilian reported a round, greenish-white object described as a ball of light with straight-line travel. The sighting lasted for approximately 30 seconds and was also reported by another observer at a different location, both of which were attributed to a meteor.
interesting points: Two observers at different locations reported seeing the same object, lending credibility to the sighting.
The object was described as a round, greenish-white ball of light with straight-line travel, indicating unusual behavior for a meteor.
The sighting lasted for about 30 seconds, providing sufficient time for observation and analysis.
The report mentions a similar previous sighting in January 1955, where a resident observed a stationary, round, reddish-orange object before it rapidly ascended and disappeared from view.
The documents were declassified after 12 years, in accordance with the declassification policy for UFO reports.
sighted object: round, greenish-white object described as a ball of light
